 I know people take no notice whatever of recommendations to read books - I'm virtually impervious to them myself. But in this instance, if you can be bothered to read it, "In Pursuit of the Millennium" by Norman Cohn will address your worries with his scholarly examination of the very, very long history of prophecies concerning "the end of the world". 
 
 After reading it, I don't think you'll ever have any sleepless nights worrying about whether the world will still be here in the morning.

I was surfing around on the net about the end of the world and all that stuff, and I came across some interesting info. One thing was that there were several ancient cultures that stated there was nothing after the year 2012. I found that peculiar. There was a bunch of information on it, I believe it was the Mayans that had made this prediction. There was a whole bunch of other stuff but I forgot now. 
 
 I was also on a site concerning biblical prophecy and there were several theologist that agreed that according to the Bible we are truly in the last days without a doubt. They argued the Apocolypse would begin now till as late as 100 years at absolute longest. 
 
 So I don't know. Just thought it was interesting. 
 
 Yes I realize people thought it was the end of the world time and time again, but this time around I think this is it.

trebor

Sorry, Charlie! Helium is an inert gas and does not burn. This is precisely why it replaced hydrogen in dirigibles.

 
 
 It is not burnt in that manner . it is basically being used for nuclear fusion. THat is how the heavier elements are formed. I don't think that the hydrogen is totally gone, but I THINK that hellium does get involved in the fusion process then.
 
 
 So, the 'being burnt' is a nuclear reaction, not a chemcial one.
snakespit

Ahh, but the world WILL end, when the sun runs out of Hydrogen. Then it will flare as it burns Helium, enlarging and engulfing everything out to approximately the orbit of Mars. We'll all be long gone by then however.

 Perhaps, however the human race will be long gone by the time this happens. If you really look at it from outside the box, it is pretty obvious that we as a race have doomed ourselves. Global warming caused by greenhouse gasses changing the climate and melting the polar icecaps, chemical and radiological pollution, "misplaced" biological timebombs capable of spreading pandemic disease, rogue states with nuclear weapons, Brittany Spears singing career, the continuous threat of global terrorism and "dirty bombs", asteroids, reality TV, etc...etc...etc... Even ice ages and world-wide droughts lasting thousands of years have occured without our being involved in heavy industry...which we have only been engaged in for a little over 200 years. The rate at which the planet is changing is startling. Who knows, perhaps the ardvarks will have taken over by then. Species rise and fall in nature all the time, and humans are not the smartest of animals. Just as the dinosaurs ruled the earth and eventually died off, so will humans. We should look at our future as crafting our longevity as a species, not saving our species.
Kuato
